title: Multiplexer and Demultiplexer
content: - **Multiplexer:** A device that combines multiple input signals into a single output signal.
**Demultiplexer:** A device that separates a single input signal into multiple output signals.
image_desc: A diagram showing a multiplexer with multiple input lines and a single output line, and a demultiplexer with a single input line and multiple output lines.
narration: Multiplexers and demultiplexers are essential components in digital circuits. Multiplexers allow us to transmit multiple signals over a single channel, while demultiplexers allow us to separate these signals at the receiving end. Imagine a busy highway with multiple lanes merging into one. A multiplexer is like the merging point, combining all the traffic into a single lane. Conversely, a demultiplexer is like a fork in the road, separating the traffic into multiple lanes again.
